data.title: chief Carine Roitfeld's family businesses
data.meta_description: Carine Roitfeld, the former editor-in-chief of Vogue France, is working closely with Sheikha Moza Bint Nasser Al-Missned to organise an unprecedented fashion show marking the end of the 2022 FIFA - 12/8/2022
data.text:
France

Ex-Vogue France editor-in-chief Carine Roitfeld's family businesses

Carine Roitfeld, the former editor-in-chief of Vogue France, is working closely with Sheikha Moza Bint Nasser Al-Missned to organise an unprecedented fashion show marking the end of the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Roitfeld, who now works as a consultant, has established a series of businesses run or owned by her children. [...]

Reading time 2 minutes

Condé Nast on the move in European downsizing

US publishing giant Condé Nast has just announced the departure of its UK teams from its historic Vogue House headquarters in London's affluent Mayfair district, but other European teams will shortly up sticks too, with France next on the list.

Luxury labels are eager to cash in on the success of Netflix hit Emily in Paris. Some brands do make the product-placement cut, but others fail - despite offering generous sums for the privilege.

Jean Touitou and his family entrusted the Rothschild bank with the sale of their high-end ready-to-wear brand A.P.C. late last year, but they aren't letting go of their well-located Paris building.

Gainsbourg family contracts out the management of its bar

Serge Gainsbourg's heirs are working to have the renowned French crooner's former Paris home opened to the public, and to build a museum and a bar nearby. Both attractions are sure to draw a large crowd, and luxury restaurants and nightclub operators are keen to get involved.

Qatar is intent on recouping some of the funds its nationals spend in the boutiques of Paris, London and Geneva. After buying Sonia Rykiel in October 2021 for a more than modest sum, G-III, the New York-based Goldfarb family company that also owns Karl Lagerfeld and Donna Karan, is relaunching the brand with pop-up stores during New York and Paris Fashion Weeks.

Vivendi to publish French edition of legendary fashion title Harper's Bazaar

French press giant Prisma Media, a subsidiary of Vivendi as of last year, is finalising its purchase of the licence to publish renowned fashion monthly Harper's Bazaar in France. Recruitment for new editorial management for the magazine is underway.
